entry.title: Steps to fix the X-Frame-Options error to integrate a CAP application into Build workzone Launchpad
entry.content:
When attempting to configure a CAP application within the SAP Build Workzone launchpad service, you might encounter the following errors:
  1. "Refused to display 'XXX' in a frame because it set 'X - Frame - Options' to 'sameorigin'."
  2. "Embedding blocked because the allowlist or the allowlist service is not configured correctly - sap/ui/security/FrameOptions."
 
Here are the steps to resolve these issues:
 
Step 1: Modify the index.html file of the UI app
Insert the following lines:
<meta name="sap.whitelistService" content="./whitelist/service" />
data - sap - ui - frame - options="trusted"
 
Step 2: Configure the whitelist endpoint in xs-app.json
Add the following block:
"whitelistService": {
    "endpoint": "/whitelist/service"
}
 
Step 3: Set the CF environment variable CJ_PROTECT_WHITELIST using the CF command
Run the following command, replacing <YOUR_CAP_APP> with the actual name of your CAP application:
cf set - env <YOUR_CAP_APP> CJ_PROTECT_WHITELIST '[{"host":"*.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com"}]'
 
This should help in successfully integrating the CAP application into the SAP Build Workzone Launchpad and resolving the X - Frame - Options error.

entry.title: üü° Fun for Week 1: The Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt üî®ü™ô
entry.content:
The contest is now over.

Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

 

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues from several missions, described in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as values for ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.‚Äå

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Hunt

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample hunt (just a warm-up, no points will be earned). Each mission is independent of the other.

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

You can also see the hex digits in the description.

26SAP Community

Inside this blog post, use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the cell immediately to the left (in this very table) and find the 6-digit RGB ASCII code for the color of the text. 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits (13 in all), in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

üëâIn this blog post, post a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase). You won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example hunt, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) hunt

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

üëâTo be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

‚Äå When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions 

 

MissionNo.
Digits		SAP Web PropertyInstructions
12

SAP Developer News

The Developer News comes out each Thursday with the latest about ABAP, CAP, BTP, SAP Build, UI5, Fiori, AI, and all your favorite SAP developer topics. All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

Most episodes about 5 minutes. Also available as a Podcast.

Watch the Developer News of Sept. 25 for this mission's clue 
26

Developer Forums in SAP Community

Check the just-released new developer forums area of the SAP Community, where you can find info about your specific area of developer interest and ask fellow community members your questions. Use it to find other community members with the same skills as you.

Go to the new Developers area and the forums by going to the top-level menu of the SAP Community and then navigating to Developers > All Developer Forums.

Check out the different topics and sub-areas (and feel free to ask any question you have about your work, or to answer someone else's).

Now search for a forum post about "Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt" for the next hex digits in the contest -- the post is in the forum topic that I cover as a Developer Advocate and which is the focus on Tuesday's of Devtoberfest. 

34

SAP Business Accelerator Hub

The SAP Business Accelerator Hub contains API reference guides, SAP Build templates, BAdIs for extensions, CDS data models, event descriptions and other artifact documentation that can help you with your development.

Explore the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, to check out all the artifacts available in SAP products for building your extensions.

When you are ready:

  1. From the main page, click the SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition tile.
  2. Open the Sales Order (A2X) service (either v2 or v4).
  3. Under API Reference, open the Batch Requests resource, and check how many API calls that resource has. From the following table, take the 4 digits next to the number that equals the number of POST calls under Batch Requests.

1 = 1D34
2 = 7823
3 = D2C6
4 = 1098
5 = A1A2
6 = E328
7 = 0ABF
8 = 3F11

42

sap-samples org in GitHub

The SAP GitHub org sap-samples contains sample code, TechEd tutorials, CodeJam material and 100s of repos from which you can learn SAP development, from ABAP to CAP to SAP Build.

  1. Go to the sap-samples org in GitHub, and check out all the sample repos to help you learn about SAP development.
  2. Watch the Developer News of Oct. 2, and learn which repo in the sap-samples org we want you to check out.
  3. Go to that repo and find the commit with the message "Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt" (NOT the merge commit). Take the commit ID and then get the 8th and 16th characters, in that order. Those are the next 2 digits of the secret code.
54

SAP Help Portal

SAP Help Portal is the main place for finding key documentation for SAP BTP services. You can now subscribe to page updates (including What's New items for the products of your choosing), get translations in about 30 languages for all documentation, content as a PDF, provide feedback, and more.

For this mission, check out 2 places on the Help Portal, and in each place you will get 2 hex digits for the secret code.

  1. First, go to the Help Portal and search for "Joule Studio". The first result will be for the product Joule Studio, the main Joule Studio documentation. On that page, find the Devtoberfest tile, which will contain your first 2 hex digits.
  2. Second, go to the SAP BTP release notes -- where you can see everything that's new for all BTP services, and you can even subscribe to receive an email whenever a new item is released in your specific service. Search for the Devtoberfest release note, and find the second set of 2 hex digits.
66

SAP Learning

SAP Learning is your first stop for learning about SAP, including tutorials and certifications for all types of development, from ABAP backend to SAP Build Apps frontend -- plus CAP, Fiori, Gen AI, Integration Suite and more.

Go to SAP Learning and then in the top menu click Browse. Select the Developer role.

Search for ABAP, and open the "SAP Certified Associate - Back-End Developer - ABAP Cloud" certification exam. This certification is for those who want to be expert in building ABAP applications based on the ABAP RESTful Application Programming (RAP) Model.

Do the following calculation:

  • Multiply the number of questions by the cut off score (between 0 and 100) by the exam time in minutes.
  • Take that number and subtract 5894.
  • Convert that number to hex, and pad with enough zeroes on the left to make it 6 digits.

Those are your hex digits for this mission.

For example, if the exam were 1 hour, with a cut off score of 50, and 35 questions, you would get the number 105,000. Subtract the number by 5894 to get 99,106 . Converting it to hex would yield 18322, and padding with zeros would yield the final answer of 018322

76

SAP Discovery Center

The SAP Discovery Center lets you explore SAP BTP services and SAP Business AI capabilities. You can see pricing, in which region each service is available, and step-by-step guides (missions) for implementing different scenarios.

Especially of note is the SAP Architecture Center, a centralized hub for SAP solution reference architectures, released in May.

This mission is divided into 2 parts, but all of it occurs inside the SAP Discovery Center.

  1. Go to the Discovery Center and search for "Joule Studio", which shows you all the missions, AI features and other artifacts related to Joule Studio.
  2. Open the "Set Up Joule Studio with SAP Build in BTP Enterprise Account" mission, which contains a project board for the task of setting up Joule Studio.
  3. On the Overview tab, you'll find the next 3 hex digits of the secret code.

Now for the second part.

  1. Go back to the Home Page of the SAP Discovery Center.
  2. Click the "SAP BTP Guidance Framework" reference architecture tile.
  3. Open "SAP Architecture Center".
  4. Browse the catalog of reference architectures and open the "Extend Joule with Joule Studio" tile, to see the reference architecture.
  5. Find the picture of Kasimir the Cat, from which you can derive the next 3 digits of the secret code. HINT: We suggest you download the picture file and take a good look at the file.

This is the toughest mission of all.

86

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

The SAP Developers YouTube channel is where you will find Antonio's videos on Integration Suite, Rekha's videos on SAP Build Process Automation, DJ's livestreams on CAP ‚Ä¶ 1200 videos in all about SAP development. Make sure to subscribe to the channel.

Go to our playlists and see all the varied content we have.

Now search for the DMS playlist (Document Management Service) and open the full playlist for DMS.

Start playing the 4th video in the playlist called "Set Up DMS with SAP Build Process Automation". A few seconds into the video, you will discover the next 6 hex digits of the secret code.

91

SAP Roadmap Explorer

The Road Map Explorer  lets you see what's being planned for your favorite SAP products. Just search for the product and then you'll see planned features for each quarter.

Go to Road Map Explorer (you will need to log in with your SAP login).

Search for Joule Studio's road map. Open any of the items and find the capability under the Capability View. The next hex digit -- just 1 digit -- is the first letter of the name of this capability.

JUST IN CASE: If for some reason you cannot log into the Roadmap Explorer, here is a second clue for the same hex digit. Go to the SAP Developer Advocates, and find the advocate who specializes in SAP Build Apps. The digit is the first letter of his/her first name.

10None (directly)

SAP Design System

The SAP Design System site shows the visual elements, UI components, and technologies that come together to build out a cohesive experience for all SAP products and  apps. Here you can explore the core building blocks that make up the SAP Design System.

For the final instructions, watch the Developer News of Oct. 16. 

Good luck!

üò∏

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Security
entry.content:
I've been spending quite some time recently diving deep into SAP Build Work Zone security, and let me tell you, it's a journey. Terms like #IAS, #BTP Subaccount #trusts, and #ShadowUsers can sometimes feel like a maze.

But then, an analogy clicked for me - the #DigitalMall and suddenly, the whole complex architecture started making perfect sense. I wanted to share this breakdown with all of you, hoping it helps.

Let's imagine SAP Build Work Zone as a bustling, modern Digital Mall, where users (you, the #shoppers) come to access various #stores (business applications) and "services" (collaboration features). Every security layer has a purpose, just like every part of a well run mall

#TheGrandOpening: Understanding this Digital Mall's Foundation

Before anyone even walks in, the mall has a master plan and a way to organize its offerings:

>>> SAP BTP Subaccount: Think of this as the Mall's Main Entrance & Security Gate. It's the primary gateway, controlling who can even step foot inside your digital space. It's where core permissions are managed.

>>> SAP Build Work Zone Tenant: This is your specific, unique instance of the Mall itself - your personalized shopping experience!

>>> #ContentManager: This acts like the Mall's Central Directory or Information Kiosk. It lists all the "stores" (your business applications) available within the mall, helping shoppers find what they need

>>> Content Providers: These are the "Department Stores" (like SAP S/4HANA
SuccessFactors) or even smaller "Boutiques" (your custom applications). They reside outside your immediate mall structure but integrate seamlessly, making their offerings available inside your Work Zone.

>>>>Stepping Inside: Your Identity & Basic Mall Access<<<<

Now, for the really crucial part: how does a "shopper" (your user) actually get into the Digital Mall, and how is their identity validated at the main entrance?

>>> #SAPCloudIdentityServices - Identity Authentication (IAS): The Mall's Central Security System / ID Proxy

This is the mandatory first stop for any user trying to enter your Work Zone mall. #IAS is your primary #IdentityProvider [IDP]

>>> #Proxy Mode: If your organization uses its own Corporate IdP (like Azure AD, Okta), IAS acts as a clever proxy. You authenticate against your corporate system, and IAS then receives that verified identity, federating it onward in a way Work Zone understands. It's seamless, you just show your corporate ID.

>>> #TheDigitalIdCard (SAML Assertion / OIDC Token): Once authenticated, IAS issues a secure token. This token is packed with vital information, essentially your digital "ID Card" that gets you past the main gate:

>>> #SubjectNameIdentifier (SNI): This is your main identifier (e.g., your Login Name or Employee ID). It's what the BTP Subaccount primarily uses.

#Assertion Attribute (often IAS UUID): This is a unique, stable, and persistent ID assigned by IAS. It's super important for internal Work Zone component communication later on, especially with the DWS (our "Community Center," which I'll cover in Part 2!)

---> Other standard user attributes like email, first name, last name.

SAP BTP Subaccount Trust Configuration: The Main Gate's Agreement with IAS

Your BTP Subaccount (the main gate) has a "trust agreement" with IAS. This allows it to confidently accept those digital ID cards (tokens) from IAS.

>>> #The XSUAA Shadow User: Your Mall Access Card. This is one of the most critical concepts

When a user successfully authenticates via IAS for the first time, a "Shadow User" record is either created or identified in the BTP Subaccount's internal user list. Think of this as your personal "Mall Access Card" record.

 

Why is it needed? Even if IAS knows who you are, the BTP Subaccount needs its own local record (the shadow user) to attach BTP Role Collections to it. These role collections are your "Mall-wide Privileges" (e.g., WorkZone_User, WorkZone_Admin) that determine what you can do across the whole Work Zone platform.

 

>>>> Crucial Point: If a shadow user doesn't exist (and automatic creation isn't enabled), login to Work Zone will fail because there is no local identity to attach permissions to.

Principal Propagation: Seamless Access to Department Stores!

Once you're in the mall and launch an app from an On-Premise Backend System (like an S/4HANA Fiori app via SAP Cloud Connector), you don't want to log in again, right?

This is where ##Principal Propagation comes in! Your identity (using the IAS SNI from the BTP trust) is seamlessly passed through the BTP Destination Service and SAP Cloud Connector directly to the backend system. The S/ 4HANA system then recognizes you and authorizes your access based on your roles within S/4HANA. It's like your Mall Access Card automatically opening the staff-only doors in a department store.

This is just the exciting first step of understanding Work Zone security. In Part 2, coming next.

The Digital Workplace Service (DWS) (the Mall's Community Center).

User and User List Provisioning (how the Community Center gets its member lists).

The critical differences between Internal vs. External Users (different types of Community Center members).

And how SCIM APIs are the "automated delivery trucks" for all this data!

Stay tuned for more insights, and in the meantime, I'd love to hear your thoughts or questions on this first part in the comments below!

Happy Work Zone-ing!

Lets connect and learn together ‚úåÔ∏è

entry.title: CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE
entry.content:
Hello All,

In this Blog I would like to share some knowledge on how to Create a basic CAPM application using Sap Business Application Studio and we are going to use the SAP S/4 Hana system to connect and fetch the data.

Lets Divide this Blog into three sections:

1. Prerequisites

2.  Connecting with S/4 HANA Data Base.

3.CRUD Operations

In this Blog lets see what are all the subscriptions and settings to be done to start our application.

Let.. Set.. Go!!

NOTE: May Be This Blog Seems To Be Lengthy, Still Give It A Try U Will Surely Love IT üòÄ

 

 

 

Step1: Lets Subscribe to SAP HANA CLOUD:

Open your SAP BTP trial account and navigate to Service Market Place. Search for S/4 Hana Cloud

 

After Selecting HANA Cloud, you will get the screen like below and Please click on Create.  

 

 

 

Click on Tools and then Create.

 

Once you click on View Subscription , here it shows as below image

 

Note: Remember after subscribing any service you should add security because every service will have its own Role Collections.

Now lets navigate to Users and Click on Default Identity Provider.

 

 

Click on Assign Role Collections, there you can find roles related to Hana cloud( You will find all the roles for the services that are subscribed).

 

 

Select them and click and assign.

 

You can find them under your role collections. Now you have your HANA DB. Lets open it.

 

Step2: Open SAP HANA Cloud and Lets Create Instance.

 

Click on Create Instance and then select HANA Cloud DB.

 

 

 

Here its asking us from which environment our service is going to run, So we need to sign in to Cloud Foundry with your Default Identity Provider Credentials( your email id).Then it returns you this Message.

 

 

 

 

 

Select your space which is default given as dev ( I renamed its as Dev). Instance name can be anything of your choice.

 

 

Enter any password of your choice.

Now leave the next step as it is with storage of 16gb and next please select allow all IP addresses so that it will not block any.

 

 

Click on the three dots over there and there you will find an option to Start. In 10 to 15min your instance would be running.

 

 

Step 3: Setup Work Zone(Fiori Launch Pad):

Search in Market Place > Work Zone

 

Click Create 

 

Please select the Plan as Subscriptions > standard. 

 

Our Subscription would be in progress.

 

 

Note: If this error exists, please subscribe to your Cloud Identity Services.

If you get this, please add trust configuration. So follow the steps below

Initially follow the same process of Subscribing Cloud Identity Provider User Role Collections

Fix: Configure OIDC Trust in SAP BTP

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit
    Go to your subaccount where you want to subscribe to the application.
  2. Go to Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration
    This is where you manage identity provider (IdP) trust settings.
  3. Add SAP Cloud Identity Services as an OIDC IdP
    • Click Establish Trust.
    • Choose SAP Cloud Identity Services.
    • Select OpenID Connect (not SAML).
    • Enter the required details (Issuer URL, Client ID, etc.) ‚Äî if you have Identity Authentication service (IAS) set up, you can copy these from there.
  4. Set as Default for Business Users

                  ÔÇ∑ Make sure the new OIDC IdP is assigned to business users in your subaccount.

  1. Save & Retry Subscription
    Go back to the subscription page and try again.

Assign the Role collections to users what are all available. Check them all and Click on Assign.

Step 4: CREATE A HANA DB INSTANCE:

Navigate to Service Market Place > Select HANA DB > Create > Under Plan select the Instance.

 

Step 5: Subscribe to Business Application Studio.

Note: By default SAP Business Application Studio would be subscribed. If not subscribe it by yourself.

 

Are you all done!! Lets get into next Episode soon...

References:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

https://help.sap.com/fiori_bs2013/helpdata/en/a7/1564526ba1f25fe10000000a423f68/content.htm?no_cache...

Hope it‚Äôs helpful üòâ

 

Thanks,
Divya MANDAVA.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Meets Multi-Tenancy
entry.content:
Introduction

Multitenancy with SAP Build Work Zone - Managed App Router in CEP (Central Entry Point) Mode‚Äã

‚ÄãSince the introduction of the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment, managing multitenant applications through the Central Launchpad Service, known as SAP Build Work Zone, has been a significant and continuous challenge.

‚ÄãAs an alternative, multitenant solutions had to rely on the Portal Service supported via a standalone app router.Managing this standalone app router at the individual project or product level to meet all security and compliance standards was a cumbersome task.‚Äã

‚ÄãThis approach increased the cost of development and maintenance.‚Äã

‚ÄãWith SAP Build Work Zone's support for multitenancy, we can now leverage the out-of-the-box feature benefits of the Managed App Router.‚Äã

‚ÄãProjects and products can shift their focus and energy towards actual business operations.

Pros:‚Äã

  • Standard Support for Managed App Router‚Äã
  • Easier Maintenance of Security and Reduced Development/Maintenance Efforts‚Äã
  • Alignment with One SAP Approach aka Golden Path, Providing a Single-Entry Point for End Users/Customers‚Äã
  • With CDM (Common Data Model) Support, Site and Content Maintenance Becomes Simplified‚Äã
  • Best fitment for SAP-managed subaccount for end customers.

Cons:‚Äã

  •  In the SAP Managed Solution, an SAP Build Work Zone subscription is a prerequisite in the subscriber subaccount.‚Äã

Step-by-Step Guide/Walkthrough of SBWZ in Multitenant Account in CEP Mode

‚û¢ Build Time Activity - Site Content Creation via CDM.json

‚û¢ Easy Maintenance of Site Config, Page/Space, Group/Catalogs

‚û¢ Translation of site content Texts Group, Page/Space via i18n

‚û¢ appId=> sap.app.id mentioned in the manifest.json file

‚û¢ vizId => cross navigation semantic object action in the manifest.json

‚û¢ Add Common Data Model (CDM) as part of MTA Build

‚û¢ Define Common Data Model (CDM) destination ‚Äì Identified by Business Solution Name defined in

manifest.json ‚Äúsap.cloud‚Äù->‚Äúservice‚Äù

‚û¢ Define runtime destination for launchpad content

‚û¢ Build the MTA application and deploy to the BTP provider subaccount.

‚û¢ Verify the CDM and runtime destination in provider sub-account

‚û¢ Export the destination

‚û¢ Subscriber subaccount -> subscribe to the multitenant application

‚û¢ Import the CDM & run time destination in subscriber subaccount

‚û¢ CDM destination in subscriber subaccount, update client secret reference from provider subaccount.

‚û¢ Runtime destination changes the URL to point to the subscriber subaccount subdomain.

‚û¢ Subscriber subaccount -> SAP Build Work Zone subscription/entitlement should be there

‚û¢Create a content channel in the subscriber subaccount Site Manager -> Content Channels by using the imported RT (runtime) and CDM (design time) destination.

‚û¢ Once it is created, refresh it to reflect the site content in the subscriber subaccount.

‚û¢ In Subscriber subaccount BTP cockpit map, the Role Collection [created by content channel] to Technical Role

‚û¢ Assign the CIS/IAS user Group to Role Collection

 

‚û¢ In Site Manager, a site is created automatically after channel creation/refresh

Configuring Multiple UI5 Apps in a Single Site Using CDM.json [CDM Merge] in CEP Mode

‚û¢ Add the CDM file in your second UI5 app, having the same site ID but different groups, catalogs and roles.

‚û¢ Keep the business solution name the same in manifest.json file

‚û¢Deploy the app, subscribe, re-import destinations, update roles, and refresh the content channel. The site stays the same, but "Go to Site" shows all groups and catalogs.

entry.title: How to Build and Deploy SAP Fiori List Report Apps on BTP with Build Work Zone
entry.content:
In this blog, I will explain the complete process ‚Äî from developing an SAP Fiori List Report application leveraging an OData service, to deploying it as an HTML5 app in the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment, and finally making it seamlessly accessible through SAP Build Work Zone

Steps to be Followed

  1. Prepare Your OData Service
  •  Develop a CDS View in your backend system or use an existing OData service.
  • To expose a CDS view as OData, add the annotation:
  • @odata.publish: true
  • Save and activate the CDS view.
  • Register the OData service in your SAP system through transaction /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE:
    • Click Add Service.
    • Search for your CDS OData service, select it, and assign it to the LOCAL system alias. Activate and test the service in SAP Gateway Client.                                                                    

      2.SAP BTP Destination & Connectivity

  • Configure a destination in SAP BTP Cockpit pointing to your backend system (where OData service is hosted)
  • Subscribe to SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

      3.Develop Fiori List Report Application in BAS

  • Open SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).
  • Create a new project from template ‚Üí Select SAP Fiori Generator ‚Üí Choose List Report Object Page template.
  • Select Data Source ‚Üí OData Service ‚Üí Choose the Main Entity with its table type.
  • Add the Deployment Configuration.
  • Select Add Application to Managed Application Router.
  • Add the Semantic Object, Action, and Title ‚Üí Click Finish.
  • Preview the application.      

                                                                                                                            

        4.Deploy Application to Cloud Foundry

  • Login to the Cloud Foundry environment using the terminal command: cf login
  • Set the target with organization and space: cf target -o <org_name> -s <space_name Example: cf target -o 3144XX6trial -s dev
  • Run build and deployment commands: npm run build & npm run deploy-config
  • Choose the target: Cloud Foundry. Destination Name and Router Module: Add Application to Managed Application Router.
  • The mta.yaml file is created.
  • Build the MTA project.
  • Deploy the MTA archive.
  • The application is successfully deployed to Cloud Foundry.
  • Check under HTML5 Applications and preview your application.                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                  

                                                               

        5.Navigate to SAP Build Work Zone

  1. Navigate to Channel Manager ‚Üí Refresh the content.
  2. Go to Content Manager / Content Explorer ‚Üí Add the contents to Business Suite.
  3. In Content Manager, create a Page.
  4. Add Page Title and Description ‚Üí Save.
  5. Edit the page ‚Üí Add a Section ‚Üí Click Add Widget ‚Üí Save.
  6. Assign the page to the Space.
  7. Navigate to Everyone Role (default role in Business Suite) and assign the specific application.

    Note

    • Go to Business Suite Settings in edit mode.
    • Change the parameters in Display ‚Üí View Mode ‚Üí Spaces and Pages ‚Äì New Experience.
    • Save the changes.
    • Click on Go to Site in Business Suite.                                                                                                                               

                                                                                                                                                                           

Conclusion: With these steps, your SAP Fiori List Report application is now developed, deployed on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, and successfully made accessible via SAP Build Work Zone.

entry.title: What‚Äôs New in SAP Build ‚Äì Q3 2025 Release Highlights
entry.content:
In Q3, we delivered several innovations across AI-powered development, ABAP project creation, modernized SAPUI5 and advanced mobile capabilities. SAP Build also reached a significant milestone with the introduction of MCP servers, allowing developers to boost productivity further with AI agents. 

Check these out in our Top 10 Release Highlights from Q3 2025! 

AI-powered development

1. Empowering developers with MCP Tools for SAP Build 

Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers are now available for the following technologies: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori. This is a huge step forward for developers working with popular IDEs and coding assistants like GitHub Copilot, Cursor and more. With these MCP servers, we‚Äôre now providing a comprehensive set of tools designed to optimize your development workflow across various SAP technologies.

Learn more in the blog post.

2. SAP HANA Cloud SQL Statement Generation in Joule

Directly in SAP Build Code, the Joule panel now offers the new command /hana-sql-gen, which enables the generation of SQL statements from natural language directly in the panel. The generated statements can be reviewed and refined in the Joule panel. Suitable SQL statements can be either copied to a SQL console or directly executed inside the Joule panel after selecting a database connection on which to run the statement.

3. Expanded AI-powered capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone

SAP Build Work Zone continues to expand its AI capabilities, bringing new built-in features to an intelligent workspace with accelerated decision-making and improved employee experiences:

  • Integration of Joule in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition: By bringing Joule into SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, users can now enjoy the power of Joule within their digital workplace. This eliminates the hassle of system-hopping, reduces time wasted on searching for information, and allows employees to focus on what is important. (Note: Available in early October)
  • AI-powered text and comment generation: This enables employees to quickly create, summarize, and engage with workplace content. For example, project managers can generate project status updates in minutes, ensuring their team members stay aligned.

Learn more in the blog post.

Enhanced App Development & Automation

4. Availability of SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free with deprecated code removed 

SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free with deprecated code removed is now available via cloud access. This means app developers can test their UI code for compliance to SAPUI5 best practices. This helps to future-proof an SAP Fiori app for future SAPUI5 versions and work on deprecated/outdated code. Developers can also provide feedback to the UI5 team.

Learn more in the blog post.

5. Create full-stack ABAP projects in SAP Build

You can now create full-stack ABAP projects or open an existing ABAP CSN as a project in SAP Build. You can also model your application using the CDS Graphical Modeler and generate ABAP development objects. By leveraging high productivity tools, this significantly accelerates time-to-market, improves collaboration and provides a standardized, compliant approach to building extensions.

Learn more in the Help Portal. ..And stay tuned! We‚Äôll share more about this topic at SAP TechEd 2025.

6. Maintenance project for released process automation projects

For process automation, we‚Äôve introduced the ability to create dedicated project versions based on an existing released version. This allows process owners to maintain parallel editable versions while keeping the latest version in place, enabling teams to focus on solving a problem without redoing everything from scratch.

Learn more in the Help Portal.

7. Outbox functionality for tasks in SAP Task Center

SAP Task Center, which provides a seamless user experience for accessing open tasks, now lets you view completed tasks in an outbox. This provides a complete view of historical data while reducing support requests and efforts around process automation instances.

New innovations for mobile

8. UI enhancements available for mobile development

The latest release of SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) is now available to customers, bringing with it multiple enhancements for UI creation. Developers can add a date range to their calendar controls, enable a read-only state, add required fields to forms, and much more.

Learn more in the latest blog post.

9. Support for new site experience in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition 

Employees accessing their workspace content via SAP Mobile Start can now enjoy a new view mode with a more flexible structuring of content. They can quickly view workspace updates, company news or project dashboards, making it easier to organize and consume information in a personalized way. (Note: Available in early October)

 

10. Updates to SAP Mobile Start

As the native mobile entry point to all SAP business apps and content, SAP Mobile Start has released several new innovations that simplify employee tasks and optimize their user experience:

  • SAP Document AI integration: Allows users to upload documents and photos for automated processing. This streamlines document handling, cuts down manual work and ensures data accuracy throughout operations.
  • Enhanced push notifications with more detailed information: Load and display context-specific details directly in the push notification, providing more meaningful and informative messages.
  • Simplified onboarding via deep link: IT teams can invite users to onboard to SAP Mobile Start via an email or message and provide a deep link that the users can use to initiate a simplified onboarding process.
  • Top news on start screen: Shows the most important news in a larger format on top of the Start screen.

Learn more in the latest blog post and Help Portal.

Ready to see these in action?

Join us for the next What‚Äôs New in SAP Build Webinar on October 8th as we dive deeper into MCP servers in CAP, SAP Mobile Start innovations, and much more!

Sign up today for your preferred option:
üåêOctober 8th, 9:00-10:00am CEST (EMEA/APJ friendly): Register here
üåêOctober 8th, 5:00-6:00pm CEST (Americas friendly): Register here
